column4: Well - I have never had an occurrence on Windoz using Kaspersky but moving to Linux I am unsure how protected I am
What program would I use to convert wav files to MP3 in Ubuntu
Audacity.
thanks
no prob. You may want to install ubuntu-restricted-extras to get all necessary codecs.
done - again - thanks!
any time. :-)
audacity recognizes the file but says it can not import it - i changed permissions to 777 but still not - any suggestions
probably still needs some codec. I'll look into it. Hang in there.
I'm just shooting in the dark from Googling, but try "sudo apt-get install lame libmp3lame0"
got the following back - libmp3lame0 is already the newest version   - when I click "help" in audacity it says "wma-proprietary" which obviously it is not a wma file.
so that's the error you are getting when you try to import the .wav?
yes
looks like you won't be able to use Audacity: http://manual.audacityteam.org/index.php?title=Wma-proprietary
I saw that too, but it specifically shows that the file is a .wav file
I just remembered some WMAs I wanted to convert to MP3, so I'll keep looking for a solution.
strange. :-/
is it possible the file extension is wrong?
hev you seen this? http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=37793
kinda old, but still may work.

I downloaded the files from a babylon 5 web site and other places and all came across as wav files and they DO PLAY in movie player - I suppose they could have been named incorrectly on the web site from which I downloaded them
I have an mp3 which opened in audacity and I edited it to have the portion I wanted and saved the project. I then saved it as a true WAV file and HURRAY it works
so the others must have been miss named
awesome. :-D
